text: South Carolinian may be tapped for top NASA job Retired Marine Maj. Gen. Charles F. Bolden Jr., a former space shuttle astronaut from South Carolina for whom the new military elementary school at Laurel Bay north of Beaufort was named
category_decision: This news text falls under the Space category as it mentions a possible NASA job appointment for a retired Marine Major General who is also a former space shuttle astronaut from South Carolina.

text: Adobe patches holes in Acrobat Reader Adobe has patched two bugs in its Acrobat Reader application that could allow an attacker to take over a user #39;s system via a malicious PDF attached to an e-mail message.
category_decision: This news article discusses the patching of vulnerabilities in Adobe's Acrobat Reader application, which is a cybersecurity issue.

text: Gullivers Travel Associates for \$1.1 billion in cash.
category_decision: This news text can be classified as Business news, specifically about a business deal or transaction involving a significant amount of money.

text: Travis Perkins to buy Wickes for 950m British building materials merchant Travis Perkins Plc said on Thursday it agreed to pay 950 million (\$1.84 billion) for home-improvement chain Wickes, sending its shares down nearly 3 percent.
category_decision: This news text can be classified as 'Business' as it reports a business transaction between two companies.

text: Bin Laden Alive, Releases Audio Tape -- Web Site An audio recording purportedly by Osama bin Laden, praising gunmen who carried out a Dec. 6 attack in Saudi Arabia, was posted on the Internet on Thursday, suggesting the al Qaeda leader is still alive.
category_decision: The news text suggests Osama bin Laden, who is associated with terrorism through his leadership of Al-Qaeda, is allegedly still alive and has released an audio tape. Therefore, it can be classified as a 'Terrorism' news text.
